Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[MSA] Encourage users to enable 2FA" (#7725) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This PR addresses 
https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2816 - 2FA dialog, 
https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2818 - Telemetry, 
https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2819 - AAD 2FA logging

Also, added feature flags for showing the dialog and getting user feedback.

The below dialog will only be showed, once per login session, to the users who do not have 2FA enabled and sign in with MSA only.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1646506/70096974-23c09200-15dd-11ea-9c91-c1044ba48408.png)

Feedback will send an email to the support alias.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1646506/70096982-28854600-15dd-11ea-9647-17567709ed24.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Application Insights is broken in NuGetGallery" (#7747) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This is as of ServerCommon 2.60.0. It's possible 2.59.0 is also affected. 2.58.0 is last known good.

Checked the following tables: 

- traces
- requests
- dependencies
- customMetrics

Checked the following apps:

- NuGetGallery
- DatabaseMigration.Gallery (DatabaseMigrationsTools)

## Before posting the issue...

* If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues)
* If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place.

1.

2.

...

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.CommandLine strongname is different than NuGet.exe ilmerged strong name" (#8887) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
That means if we run tests such as: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/test/NuGet.Clients.Tests/NuGet.CommandLine.Test/ExtensionsTests.cs#L13 with the ilmerged assembly instead of the regular one, it will fail. 

Note that I'm making a shift to use the il merged assemblies for testing in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3003

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Apex tests without clearing output and error list in VS affect each other" (#8884) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Discover this issue in netcore5.0 testing, found duplicate timestamps in log.
We should isolate tests by clearing output and error list at the beginning of each test.

Also found test CreateNetCoreProject_AddProjectReference passes incorrectly. 
We should add a assert statement to make sure it fail when error occurs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Copying nuget packages from one feed to another" (#8886) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Problem:

We have several branches on the way to release our product....I mention 2 here:
Developers machines
Dev Branch
We have a single feed for all packages called "ourproduct"

The developers build, create and test packages on their local machines.

At present they can use labels like alpha beta etc....prerelease versions..and they released directly to "ourproduct" feed.

Our CI uses the "Dev branch" and the "ourproduct" feed

When developers are ready they then check in their code to the "Dev branch", at present this can still reference a prerelease version.
The CI runs various tests on this branch which has access to the "ourproduct" feed.

Everything works fine...but now we want to release to our clients, but our tested packages are marked as prerelease...they are immutable.

I don't want to recompile the packages as different compilers might cause issues.

Solution:

So what if I do not use prerelease package versions....and I have 2 feeds...1 called "developers" 1 called "ourproduct".
Developers only use the "developers" feed
CI uses Dev branch and "ourproduct" feed

The process could now be developers do work, when they are happy to check into "Dev branch" and **copy packages** to the "ourproduct" feed.

This way we only end up with releaseable packages in the "ourproduct" feed.
